metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6353 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - untriaged.
metadata.Description: The Python console in Electrum through 2.9.4 and 3.x through 3.0.5 supports arbitrary Python code without considering (1) social-engineering attacks in which a user pastes code that they do not understand and (2) code pasted by a physically proximate attacker at an unattended workstation, which makes it easier for attackers to steal Bitcoin via hook code that runs at a later time when the wallet password has been entered, a different vulnerability than CVE-2018-1000022.

criterions.comment: electrum: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
